intro: Lavoisiera caparaoensis, commonly known as the Caparaó lavoisier, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments within the Atlantic Forest biome. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
